result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony L Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $100 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay fine/costs or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.

($1,516.50 total due, $673.50 for this file and $843 for 16-TR-1774)

Defendant Anthony L Perez in court.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State indicates defendant needs a little more time to prepay fine/costs, ($1,516.50 total due, $673.50 for this file and $843 for 16-TR-1774) she has no objection to 60 day adjournment. Court adjourns matter. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 28, 2017 at 09:15 am.

for DNA Sample

Defendant Anthony L Perez in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file.  State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Ct. 1.  Defendant stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2, 16-TR-1775 & 1860 but reads in for sentencing. Defendant asks court to set off sentencing for 60 days to allow him time to prepay fine/costs. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2017 at 08:45 am.

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol when driving.

Defendant Anthony L Perez in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.   Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel.  Court questions Defendant, finds defendant competent to proceed, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Defendant to make appointment with DA.  Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted 9/15/16.
